0: Sanford puts past behind him NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Rep-elect Mark Sanford says he'll put the past behind him and work with fellow Republicans in Congress, even though the GOP establishment deserted him weeks before the special election in South Carolina. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “I’m a Republican who has always had an independent streak that would be the best way to define it. The past is the past,” Sanford said on “Fox News Sunday.” “I look forward to working with the Republican team.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Sanford also said he has learned a lot in the past few years since his affair with a woman from Argentina while serving as governor. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “You probably learn more from the valleys of life than you do from the mountain tops,” he said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “I learned a lot about judgment. I learned a lot about forgiveness," Sanford said. "I could go down a litany of things. I’ll boil it down this way: Our minister gave a great sermon a few months back and his point was, ‘Do the events in our life refine or define your life?'
